SnT is a leading international research and innovation centre in secure, reliable and trustworthy ICT systems and services. We play an instrumental role in Luxembourg by fueling innovation through research partnerships with industry, boosting R&D investments leading to economic growth, and attracting highly qualified talent.

The Centre is currently expanding its research activities and is seeking highly motivated research associates who wish to pursue research in close cooperation with our partners. For further information you may check: www.securityandtrust.lu, http://wwwen.uni.lu/snt/research/spacer

Your Role...

The successful candidate will join the young, strong and motivated SpaceR research group focused on increasing the autonomy of aerial, planetary and orbital robotics for on-earth applications, space exploration, on-orbit servicing and manufacturing, and space resource utilization. This innovative research group is led by Prof. Miguel Olivares-Mendez.

We offer two different career paths for scientific staff, depending on their focus on an academic or industry career. In our academic track, candidates focus on publications, research grants, teaching experience, and community engagement, while maintaining a positive relationship to industry to get access to first-hand research data. In our industry track, candidates will prepare themselves for a career in industry or in a start-up while utilitzing their previous theoretical knowledge. They will build relationships with our industry partners while having freedom to pursue their own ideas in an innovative and dynamic environment.

Successful candidates will perform the following tasks (weighting according to chosen track):

  • Carrying out research in the predefined areas
  • Disseminating results through scientific publications
  • Providing guidance to PhD and master students
  • Communicating and working with companies in the space sector and stakeholders in government
  • Preparing research proposals to attract industry partnerships as well as national and European grant projects
  • Managing research projects and preparing project deliverables
  • Cooperate within other projects and with colleagues at SpaceR in common robotics approaches
  • Participating in research proposal drafting and project deliverables
  • Assisting in the organization of relevant workshops and demos
